comments.body: some people "probably won't like" any of the updates, from the pretty scary update to the world of color to even the unneccesary bee one. 1.17 is not any different from the other 16 updates.

I'd like this to be a feature for Java too! Just as we can select amplified, super flat, or custom for a world type, it would be fantastic to have an Old Gen world type so we can experience a bit of nostalgia in the future!

I make Minecraft addons and I have a youtube channel https://www.youtube.com/c/NickMotions/videos 

I was actually working on a new map and I stumbled upon a string called base_game_version in the MCTEMPLATE manifest.json

basically it locks your world on an update, and if you set it to something like 1.16.5 or earlier you will get 1.16 world generation back. they kept the old world gen code so marketplace maps wouldn't get corrupted. but they could theoretically take the code and make a world type with it.

This only exists in the bedrock edition. on java it will be different

I make Minecraft addons and I have a youtube channel https://www.youtube.com/c/NickMotions/videos 

I was actually working on a new map and I stumbled upon a string called base_game_version in the MCTEMPLATE manifest.json

basically it locks your world on an update, and if you set it to something like 1.16.5 or earlier you will get 1.16 world generation back. they kept the old world gen code so marketplace maps wouldn't get corrupted. but they could theoretically take the code and make a world type with it.

This only exists in the bedrock edition. on java it will be different

Having a stunning option would be a fantastic idea! I completely agree it would be nice to be able to do something where we can be given an extra chance to get away! As far as it's looking right now it almost seems like if the warden is summoned you're pretty much done for... so this kinda thing would definitely be helpful! 

Also fully agree that attacking it while stunned shouldn't be possible or should have some sort of punishment where if you try to harm it while in a stunned state something bad happens whether you die, are harmed, are knocked back really far, have some bad potion effect, etc.

I Totally Agree.

It's Really Hard To Kill The Warden It's Buff And Even With Prot 4 And Enchanted Golden Apples It's Near Impossible To Come Out Alive. It's Also A Lot Harder Boss Than The Ender Dragon Or Wither. I Think If It Had A Weakness It Would Be A Cooldown Or A Weak Spot.

I've always wanted pebbles generating in Minecraft caves and overworld fields, they'll look amazing and will bring Minecraft to life! You can make them renewable by simply adding a cobblestone crafting recipe, turning them into pebbles.
could also bring in the opportunity for a slingshot
Or, water below y level 0 could be darker, murkier to fit in with the Grimstone aesthetic.
i wanted to say this since i saw swamp water in caves.
I feel like grimstone generated mineshaft should be more wider and bigger to fit the warden
Was thinking the same thing

This is a must! The oak does not blend well with the deepslate, as it is too light making it feel very unnatural. I hope they consider this, because darker wood feels so right. (Additionally, darker wood makes more sense, as it adds a sense of decay or age to the Mineshaft.

I really love that idea, but considering the fact that the ores below y=0 spawn MUCH more frequently as it is, I think that it's possible that that might unbalance the game (just increasing your ore loot exponentially at that point).

Diamond and Redstone already spawn in much higher quantities below y=0, or at least that is the current plan. Having higher Fortune yields would be redundant and overpowered, since there are already higher quantities of the ores to reward you for taking the risk and mining effort, since Grimstone is slower to mine, and you will likely come accross the Deep Dark and the Warden below y=0. The "Grimstone ores" will exist so that the ores fit the Grimstone around them, they're not really new ores.
I disagree, I think the only reason you should mine down that low is for the really high diamond rate. The reward is already high enough
You should also get double resources and experience from smelting ores embedded in grimstone. This would make exploring the depths more rewarding.
Nice idea it'd be just like pigstep instead you obtain it in a mineshaft instead of a bastion
Nice that idea
More music disc will be cool
i think the deep dark already has a disc the ward , am i the only one who thinks the disc ward has anything to do with the wearden?
What if the disc is a grimstone hue because it comes from the depths of the caves

I think there should be maybe 4 music disc in the caves and cliffs update. It would be really really cool. But I think that we will get only 2... if. And if yes, which would be cool. They could be named like "in the dark" or "at the top". Like in the dark, the tone would be quiet and it would fade away in the end. And at the top it would be loud and the tone would go higher.
More structure for different biomes
haha, I might have just done this same one! XD Love it!
May help for people with low end devices who can’t run the new world generation
we need a button to disable the cave and cliffs world generation
It would be so scary if you opened a chest in the deep dark, and it launches itself at you.
As a old D&D player I would love to see mimics in the game - adds a risk/reward element for exploring

I agree that having the tiny blobs currently looks horrible in the new generation, so to me the solutions would either be like you mentioned:
1. new cave biomes that generate made out of the 3 rock types. This would add a new exploration element to hunt down blocks for building and add more variety when caving.
2. Dramatically increase in the size of the blobs, so entire walls of the caves are made out of huge chunks of the rock types. so its less blotchy and more varied,
Also, I think ores should blend with the stone types around them instead of always having a normal stone background.
What about what about people not on keyboard?

Bedrock doesnt even have spectator mode anyway so I think this is a good method for doing this. Maybe even just make it automatic when you enter the mode? I cant see any utility for not having it other than viewing a mob farm or build as it is naturally. Would help for spectating worlds that hardcore players have died in too.
I agree, more customizable flower pots would be great.
I love this idea! It definitely fits with 1.20's customization!

I like the idea of a copper shield, but not in the way suggested. Personally, I think this would work best:

The copper shield acts like a regular shield, but has more durability. It's a standard shield with a copper plating. You'd craft this by putting a shield in the center of the crafting table, then filling the remaing slots with copper ingots.

For this to really work, copper could be rarer than iron and found deeper, but it would work fine with the current rarity.
Another addition that could be made is that a trident with the channeling enchantment could do extra damage and also take down the shield, given that copper is a great conductor
Yes, I agree the cave vines can be placed under leaves blocks very much, just like weeping vines under nether wart blocks
Maybe redstone golems could be a boss in regular mineshafts. Mineshafts have been neglected for a long time, even when it comes to bug fixes.

I imagine the redstone caves as a dark place with red stone crystals that glow a little and filled with red stone cubes (the redstone golem / monstrosity is too hard to fight): they too will glow a little and they will roll to attack the player. You can also find abandoned mine shafts powered by redstone, so you can easily travel with a mine cart to mine as many redstone and redstone crystals as you can find. Villagers will not spawn here to make the setting darker and more mysterious.
maybe there could be blindness effects
This is actually a great idea. Right now, the glow squid is useless other than glow ink sacs, and this addresses the issue perfectly!
I think that its a good idea!
nice idea!
Knife in minecraft.
the end ores would have end stone backround instead of stone and nether ores netherrack
Its already easy enough to get these resources. We don't need anymore.
this would break the game balance
it could be the potion of "life" and when splashed on mobs reduces the cooldown time of breeding and speed up baby growth. maybe it even acts as food

We could definitely use more brewing, especially with plants, and this could give the roots an interesting feature. One thing though to note; I believe that the block name should simply be "Hanging Root (Block)" and "Root Block" instead of having Azalea in the name, as detailed in a large post I made. This relates to ideas about also possibly having small amounts of the root block under all tree's bases, and consistency, as well as why it should be this way. It is a small thing but I feel it should definitely be this way.
A trophy item would be an incentive for players to attack the Warden which Mojang does not want
I like this! Got to say this would not make people kill the warden but rather do it for a slight achievement they would only need to do once. I don’t think it should do anything tho.

Ok, first how are you going to get a creeper down into the ground? and even with the creative mode, you can't the achievement and for another you can't get a charged creeper there tho unless with hacks and I still think this is a bad idea for Minecraft...

3: A rare and dangerous attack. Summons a mini tornado which sucks you up into it if at least 3 blocks away, which you will be unless you back off as it summons. When up there, will spin you around 3-4 times, will be quick and uncontrollable. Every spin takes 0.4 seconds, and deals 2 damage (1 heart). Any other by passers who happen to be in the radius of the static tornado will also be sucked in (but not any other illagers/raiders).

Btw, players with netherite armour and mobs with knockback resistance will not be nearly as vulnerable to these winds.

Also, maybe mountaineers could be added alongside? Or replace pillager patrols and outposts in cold biomes? And could spawn in cold village raids?

And if mountaineers were to be added, here's their factfile

hp: 24

attack strength: 7 normal mode(3.5 hearts)

drops: 0-1 snowballs, 0-2 emeralds and rarely their pickaxe/axe. 

behaviour: similar to vindicators in attack style. less damage, aren't slowed down by snow. Can also spawn as captains. Big difference is that they can, as well as breaking down wooden doors, like vindicators, in hard, can break iron (because of their pickaxe).

I think one of the attacks could be a sneak attack like sins he is a illeger he has power so he could also tern into a block with a new potion (that turns players/entity’s into the Nernst block) and when you are at least three blocks apart he will pop out and use a new attack that he makes clones of him self and rapidly attacks you, if you kill him within five seconds you get a special drop that lets you make the potion. 

P.S your grammars better then mine.
I think they should spawn in some sort of structure because it'd be annoying to be knocked off the mountains constantly.
Well, if there is a structure, there should be loot
I haft to say I agree

Additional Info: Copper golems are named Sentinels, and they spawn 10-20 blocks away from the dwarves. meaning if you are near the dwarves they will spawn a sentinel in a distance away from you, making sure you can build a farm where they can be automatically farmed, they will go for mobs with armor but when they touch water they will take damage but not with lava. if they touch lava they hit you harder and sets you on fire. they will stop attacking you if you put water on them they will stop moving and take damage, they will become docile if you heal them by giving them copper ingot just like how iron golems heal with iron. but it wont be precise and accurate it works by chance.
Maybe they give you better stuff if you give them better metals (copper = junk. iron = decent. gold = good)

What if they could use copper as "currency", like piglins use gold? And in the dwarven caves, there could be blocks that look like stone (yes, these would be in every stone variant) but has a small black hole. These would be called "dwaren nests" or "dwaren holes", where dwares could run sometimes, just like bees do with bee nests. (sorry for my English spelling)

If you have a pickaxe on your dwarf, and you find ore in it, you'll mine and retrieve it ... Also, if the dwarf gets in the sun, it will be damaged and die from it, dropping round stones. This is because dwarves are not good at sunlight.
They could spawn from gravel, but from stone it would just cluter your inventory
Make it like a 1/10 chance of occurring so there is a reason to do this but not a priority method.
